body: A Land of Giants  This dramatic landscape testifies to nature's size, beauty, and diversity--huge mountains, rugged foothills, deep canyons, vast caverns, and the world's largest trees. These two parks lie side by side in the southern Sierra Nevada east of the San Joaquin Valley. Weather varies a lot by season and elevation, which ranges from 1,370' to 14,494'. Sequoias grow at 5,000 - 7,000', above usual snowline.                Store food properly to protect bears   Black bears are active year-round in these parks. Storing food properly can help prevent vehicle break-ins.        Experience Wilderness   Glacial canyons, lush meadows, oak woodlands, and granite peaks offer unparalleled opportunities for challenge and solitude.               Find Your Park!   Learn about activities and events that celebrate the National Park Service's Anniversary!        Things to Do   A wide range of activities in diverse settings awaits you at these parks.              Camping   Learn about camping options throughout the parks.        Buy Digital Entrance Passes   Use an app from our partner to buy entrance passes before you get to the park!        Lodging   Four lodges operate in these parks, including two that are open year-round.
